name: Alex
review: Lighting is very poor quality

name: Sue
review: I bought the Revelon brand name lighted makeup mirror because I have used that brand named mirror for the last 18 years and have absolutely loved the bright light that it had.  I bought a new light bulb for it when the light finally quit working, but that didn't fix it, so I set out to buy another one.   However the Revlon touch mirror I just purchased is so dim, even on high that I can't even really tell the light is on at all.  And every time I touch it, it either turns the light off or dims it even more.  Very disappointed!  I feel like I've had the very best mirror light in the past, that's why I bought Revelon brand name again without even doing any research.  Needless to say, I'm very disappointed with my purchase!  Will do my homework and research next time......shame on me!!!!!

name: lea
review: this mirror sucks.... whenever the light bulb needs to be changed... it completely stops working

name: Mom
review: Use to apply makeup. Light is not very bright, it is a great mirror.

name: Alex
review: I didn't like that the light was as bright as I thought it was before purchasing.

name: Jenna Lee
review: This mirror does not get bright enough to be useful for makeup application.

name: Frankie
review: Like other reviews said, it is a very dim light on the brightest setting. I have to use another light to actually see the makeup I'm applying. Is it that hard to use brighter bulbs?? I also don't know if I like the touch base (to turn the light on). I put my makeup around the base and constantly touch it by accident and the light will turn off. I waited a long time to get a mirror like this only to be disappointed. I gave it 2 stars because the mirror used in bright daylight works very well... maybe I'm being too nice.

name: Cousins Nana
review: I expected this mirror to be brighter. No significant difference from looking into a regular mirror.

name: Clear skin
review: Great magnification for detail makeup application

name: Betty
review: Although this has three light settings, none of them are very bright. Even the brightest one seems dim to me. I never use the other two. The selling point for me was the indoor/outdoor lighting options, so I'm a bit disappointed that the lighting is mediocre on this mirror.

name: Katiecakes
review: I will be returning this mirror. It doesn't have enough light and a slight touch of the base turns it off.

name: Kildee
review: I returned this mirror for one with a brighter light.

name: hospice nurse
review: I like the mirror alot.  My only concern is that the light fixture in it will go bad like the first one was upon purchase.  But so far everything is working well.

name: Mish
review: This is going back. The light is useless. Also, can you tell me the logic of sticking TWO stickers on the mirror that do NOT come off easily. I am disappointed to say the least. NOT WORTH THE MONEY

name: Cindi
review: I returned the product because the light was not bright enough and the touch control was so sensitive that I kept turning the light off while doing my makeup.

name: mrs gracey
review: Not impressed with this mirror. It has three different light settings, and still not bright enough you still need extra lighting. The touch feature is too sensitive.

name: Beth
review: Not what I had hoped for but will keep and use.

name: Jules
review: very poor quality mirrors

name: Mizmakeupjunkie
review: I love a good makeup mirror but the first time using this mirror the bulb blew as I was half way putting my make up on. Took back and had no problems getting my $ back. I think it may have just been a lemon.

name: Pat the football fan
review:
*light is not bright enough
*light turns off too easily, a problem when you just lightly brush the base with hand or make-up item
*magnification not clear

name: Clex
review: The light on this is so dim that having no lights on or a light on in another room might actually be brighter than this. Not worth the price, unless you get it for free.

name: Ginny
review: The lighting is awful.  I also have to use a lamp to see well enough.

name: SouthunLady
review: While this mirror is just the right height for me to apply my makeup, it doesn't have the light selections/brightness I need.

name: Barbara
review: Love the product!  One thing:  While I love the touch feature and how the lighting gets stronger with each touch, there is only one setting in terms of type of light, which seems to be more of an evening setting.

name: Caitlin
review: I use this product every morning when I am getting ready. I really like that mirror part; it's clear and the magnification side is great. I wish the mirrow was a round shape instead of oval. I couldn't tell by the box. The thing I literally hate about this product is that the base is activated by touch. It turns off if anything touches it, such as a face wipe or the sleeve to my robe. It's very frustrating, and I will never purchase anything like this again.

name: Robin
review: Do not buy for a bright light because it is not very bright at all.

name: hilly
review: I use this product to apply my makeup and tweeze.

name: Lindsay
review: This double sided mirror produces three choices of light, but all are dim and give off a yellow tone. Not good for applying foundation.

name: Char
review: Dim. Just not worth buying.

name: Kats
review: used for putting on makeup

name: Ash
review: I liked the look but the if it was LED light it would be a lot better

name: Luvlee_ness
review: The mirror is amazing but the light was very dull , I could Bearly see with the light , and it was as dull as my night light ..... Wish it was brighter to where I can see all the flaws

name: Myabear
review: Great mirror for the price, wish they would not put there sticker right on the glass mirror on each side. Took a hour to peel off the sticker!

name: TJ
review: I use this product every day when I apply makeup,. This one is perfect. I have tried cheaper ones and you get what you paid for.  Al in All love it!

name: marsha the runner
review: I do not like the touch on and off system. When applying make-up a slight touch shuts the phone off.

name: Rachel
review: This mirror is a piece of junk to be perfectly honest. The lighting is awful. The main purpose of buying a lighted makeup mirror is to have adequate LIGHTING. Do not waste your money. I have an old school conair that has brighter lighting even on it's darkest setting. I just bought this tonight and will be returning it for a different one ASAP.

name: Alice in ATX
review: I live in an RV so my lightijg is poor. I bought this mirror to resolve that issue. It was wasn't bright enough. I didn't ever use the magnification side so I can't speak to it. All magnification mirrors seem distorted to me. I did like the adjustibility of the mirror

name: Judi
review: For makeup you need a very bright light. This product isn't as good as a regular light bulb.

name: Mell
review: The light is too dim and the shape is too narrow. The stickers were hard to remove. I think the weight is good. The packaging was good.

name: Savvy Shopper
review: I use for makeup and hair. Others mention the touch on/off being too sensitive (which almost kept me from buying this mirror).  I really haven't had this problem. The lighting is good but I really only use the brightest level.

name: shan0605
review: The lighting is so dim (on the highest setting) it's useless. I realize it's touch controlled, but even if you barely graze the surface it will cut off. The only pro was the mirror size.

name: Hellokatheee
review: I love this product so much when I first bought it. However, the light wasn't as bright as I expected. Also, it's a touch light. After one week of owning this mirror, the light bulb busted. This also plugs into the wall. I had to return it for another brand.

name: teacher
review: I use this to do my makeup and the light is not strong enough, plus it is too sensitive to touch and when I try to adjust the mirror, the light goes off. Frustrating!

name: Tami, mom of 3 girls
review: Really liked the first one and just bought a second...possibly a third for Christmas!

name: starlightgazer
review: Nice enough mirror but I have to move it to use it (isn't stationary on a table) and the touch screen kept going on when I'd put it back, without my knowing it.  2 times I found it back on.  I guess it would be OK if you have a permanent spot for it.

name: AH
review: The light broke after the first time I used it. Returned.

name: Sandy
review:
The room I apply makeup is poorly lit, so this mirror didn't work. I exchanged it for a bright model, which works perfectly.

I also found myself changing light intensities accidentally by bumping the base, which was frustrating.

name: Hairquennie
review: The problem I had with this mirror is the lighting. The lighting should just not be called a light. If you are looking for function excluding light then this is a pretty mirror. I purchased for the light as well. I will be returning to the store.

name: Mary Q
review: Never had a chance to use mirror.  Touch did not light it up so I returned it to store and did not get another.  Store in Panama City Beach FL did not have a large selection of mirrors to substitute.

name: Melstrouble1
review: I love the way it looks and does not seem to clutter my counter top however the light just is not bright enough.

name: Cyndigee
review: Great for seeing your face up close

name: Micah
review: I love the mirror but the touch to turn it on is difficult to keep on because it is so easy to rest my hand near it or touch it accidentally without it turning off.

name: Cire
review: My brother bought this for me and it stopped lighting up 1 month later ..

name: Phil
review: Love this mirror!

name: Brittany
review: The mirror is not bright at all!!! It's no where near bright enough to apply makeup in any setting. I returned it instantly.

name: Viianeym19
review: This mirror is very cheaply made. I purchased one and returned it the same day because it was dented. It also heats up if you have it on for more then 2 minutes. This is not a good investment.  Buy the conair one instead.

name: Kat
review: Magenifaction could be better

name: Pauly
review: The touch lighting was a con because it would turn off on its own. The lighting was not bright enough for makeup application

name: Kim
review: I like it but should have gone with a bigger and brighter mirror. I should not have settled based on awesome price. Still a good choice just not a good choice for me.

name: Denise
review: Brand new in box, brought it home, didn't work. Took it back and didn't repurchase.

name: CRom
review: I like the magnification of the mirror but the lighting is not bright enough.

name: Lisa
review: The lighting is not good. I prefer circle rather oval mirror. I like Switch on/off not Touch on/off. I will return the item.

name: Karena Garay
review: It's so easy to use! Love the tap to turn on and off so light weight!

name: Christina
review: The light is not bright enough. If they had a display I would not of purchased this item.

name: Kchand09
review: This mirror is great for desktop use.

name: sav
review: I am so unsatisfied with this mirror. I have been looking for a new lighted make up mirror and this was one of the only ones left in Ulta so I got it. I got home and was excited to plug it in. The touch command worked at first. I turned it off and went to turn it on again like 10 minutes later and it would not come on. The next day I check it again and it comes on, but I go to the store anyway to try to find bulbs just in case. I take the mirror lid off and can't get it back on. I am so mad and disappointed in this. I am returning and ordering one with great ratings!

name: Dawn
review: This is not what I was expecting. I am returning this item.

name: Lex
review: I love that it has the touch to light feature however the quality stinks! Not worth the price! Light is yellowish and not bright at all

name: Rori
review: The light is to dim. Not clear

name: Deb
review: Great to see my face and applying makeup

name: Ingrid
review: This is the perfect size for a mirror on your bathroom counter!

name: CeCe
review: The mirror is great quality just wish it had more light choices other than just 3.

name: Doe Jane
review: Bino makeup mirrors are far better than this.  Revlon, how do you get away with selling this as a lighted makeup mirror?  The highest, brightest setting is the equivalent of putting on your makeup with one tea light candle.  If you don't mind a dim tea light candle, save your money and just use a candle to apply your makeup.  The mirror was distorted and gave me a headache to look into it on both sides.  I'm going to  go back to my Bino NON-LIGHTED makeup mirror and just use a lamp and 75 watt light bulb with no lamp shade.  What a waste of time and money.  I had to drive a long distance to get this, too.  So frustrated.

name: Ann
review: The lighting could be a lot brighter but for the price it's a good deal

name: Melinda
review: The mirror itself ia great but I feel the lighting is not very bright. The touch base seemed like a great feature but I end up getting more frustrated with the fact If I bump the base the light turns off and also leaves  finger prints when you touch it.

name: jim the runner
review: I loved this mirror, it was a great one. We had so many great times together. We stayed up late trying different makeup looks and had so many laughs, then the darkness came. The lightbulb went out and so did my heart. I found the same lightbulb in hopes that it would come back to me, but it never came back on.

name: Jo
review: I am over 40 and have to wear glasses for close up reading so this mirror is a life saver!

name: Tiffany
review: Love it! Got it as a birthday gift!

name: pglad
review: I had one for about a year that I did like because I always used it in a bright room, about 8 months after purchase the touch stopped working with the light on so knew it wasn't just the light bulb. I bought a second and realized how dull the light is and it was also put on wrong.

name: PeekABoo Dollie
review: It took me a few minutes to get used to mirrors' magnifying effect but now I don't have to keep taking my glasses on and off to see how my make up looks as I am applying it...

name: Karen
review: I love the fact that his touch

name: NikkiAnn
review: I was trying to find a replacement for my 15 year old makeup mirror. This was was dimmer than my old one and it gives off warm colored light, which is flattering but not what you want when you're trying to apply makeup evenly (you want natural light for that). Gave it two stars because I liked the look of the mirror and looked nice on my table.

name: CurlyTop
review: I have used this mirror for a week and just am not thrilled with it. It is rather small and the light is not as bright as I'd hoped since the area where I use it is not well lit. The magnification isn't as good as my previous mirror so some things are more challenging. Nothing wrong with the mirror, it just isn't quite what I was looking for so will be returning it.

name: darysel
review: this so good! i use to have a mirror but it was was ran by batteries and that wasnt good bc i would waste the batteries SO FAST. now this one plugs into the wall and never finishes. i do think you have to change the light buld tho but thats like once or twice every year.

name: MariaBlanco
review: Love the light settings

name: Zury
review: The quality sucks and the lighting is horrible

name: Liz
review: Great item!!!

name: Amber
review: I bought this mirror for my vanity. The light is so dim I can't see anything while doing my makeup.

name: Myra
review: The pedestal style of this product attracted me because it saved space on my vanity. The magnification was good, but the brightest level of light was extremely dim.  Also, the touch on/off feature on the mirror's base is so sensitive that the slightest contact with anything would turn the lights off.

name: Megs
review: I wanted a bright light, that would make it easy to apply my makeup in a dark lighted room, but I didn't think this light cut it. For me personally I thought it was not bright at all.. But if you aren't looking for a bright LED vanity light, this is your one

name: Kngyowell
review: The mirror is easy to move around and works fine putting on my make up and tweezing eyebrows. The light does not signifigantly help but fortunately my bathroom is well lit so I don't need it. Probably wouldn't buy it again as it is overpriced for what it offers

name: tled
review: It was a little too large for my space and I had to be right up on it in order to get the full effect of the light. I'm now using a regular LED lamp & mirror instead.

name: ForeverYours_4572
review: I don't think the brightness levels are that great. The only one that helps is the highest one unless you're already in a well light room.. When it gets hot you can feel the warmth on your face and if you try to flip the mirror it feels super hot! The touch turn on is quick and easy, but that means it's also very easy to accidently turn off constantly. The cord is nice and long, too.

name: Sairisan90
review: I bought this mirror needing something that lit up for my vanity.  I owned this for three months and then it stopped working.  If you want something that is going to last a long time, invest in something ELSE.

name: Ana
review: The mirror gets too hot..had to return it.

name: Amanda
review: This is very sensitive and I keep touching it as I put my eye makeup on.

name: Stinabella
review: I bought this to use when putting on makeup. The mirror is great, but the three level light doesn't help much. It's basically extremely dim, rather dim, and somewhat dim. You must have alternate background light to make it useable. With more light, it's very nice.

name: Mel
review: The light is nice and bright. The enhanced mirror helps with detail work. The only negative is that the touch base is very sensitive and I have to keep it unplugged when it's not in use.

name: beauty queen
review: The lighing is very dim, even on the highest setting. The touch feature was not what I expected - I thought only the base would turn the lights off and on but the entire mirror was touch sensitive, so every time I needed to adjust the mirror, the lighting changed! Did not like this product and will be returning it.

name: Chardonnay
review: I had to return it because it was too dim even on the brightest setting. Unfortunately I didn't get a chance to try out other performance details.

name: jen
review: Terrible.  Very distorted just like the fun mirrors at the circus. Don't purchase.

name: crys
review: i use the product to apply makeup

name: jen
review: Save your money. Buy a better mirror .

name: Jaclyn
review: a little pricey but totally worth it. nice magnification. touch base for three lighting settings.

name: Kat
review: I wanted something that lights so I could use it for both makeup and eyebrow maintenance.  This just wasn't it.  At 7X magnification, the image was distorted unless you hugged the mirror.  The light at intensity 3 was still very dim, more like a 25 watt bulb than a makeup mirror.  At intensity 1 it didn't even match my nightlight.

name: Jean la
review: Nice mirror and pretty. The height is perfect. I tried to use this mirror for makeup application and tweezing, but the light wasn't bright enough.

name: mrsk
review: This is a beginners mirror , good if you are looking for a inexpensive makeup mirror.  Light could be brighter and it is a little distorted.

name: Red
review: The slightest touch turns the light off. When putting on makeup, using your hands and moving back and forth to pick up or put down supplies, I inadvertently "brush up"against the mirror or the base of the product and the light immediately shuts off. Very distracting and frustrating. I gave it three days and finally returned it for another model.

name: Mish
review: I do not recommend this mirror. The light is useless and it turns on and off at the slightest touch. I returned this item

name: Brit and Barts Mum
review: This mirror was not large enough to be helpful.  The lights weren't bright, the magnification was fine.  It just didn't work for me.

name: Court
review: College Dorm for makeup

name: Bella_Chaos7
review: I loved the style of the mirror and it was for a decent price, however, when I got it home and tried to use it the light was hardly bright enough on any setting to see myself. I even looked to see inside if I could put a brighter bulb in it and there is a warning not to go over 25 watts. Also, the tough base is just way too easy to touch by mistake why trying to apply makeup.. Very dissappointed in this product..

name: dental diva
review: I like this product because you don't have to buy batteries and it's easy to keep clean. Just plug it in and your on your way to a better looking you.

name: Lid
review: Took it back for a refund. Sooo disappointed in lighting and magnification and size. Should have a display in store so that it's not a waste of my time to have to bring it back.

name: Yes
review: Poor lighting

name: Tatis
review: It would be perfect if the light would be brighter and if it wasn't a touch mirror because it turns off very easy with almost anything. Sadly I had to return it.

name: velk
review: Great for close up work like plucking eyebrows.  Lighting is average, could be a little brighter.  After trying several brands, I settled with this one for size, and no distortion on the magnification side of the mirror.

name: Glo
review: I really needed this mirror because without my glasses I couldn't see to put on my makeup. With this mirror I can put on my makeup with ease.

name: Easy beauty
review: I have to return this, bought it to replace the one I left behind on vacation, unfortunately it makes me dizzy trying to apply my eyes because it is distorted, maybe because the oval shape, idk, my other one was round and I loved it!

name: Heywood
review: Big disappointment!

name: Ultanewbie
review: The lighting with the mirror was not strong enough for me.  I have trouble seeing, it may work for others.

name: andrea2000
review: I use this product every day when I put on my make up and also to shape my eyebrows or put any special creams or lotions on my face.

name: Lori the "Returner"
review: I am going to return this mirror because the Lighting feature is so weak that it does not light up your face enough to do makeup well.

name: Acassels152@gmail.com
review:
I don't have much knighting I
In my bathroom also great for plucking or waking

name: mp2012
review: Have no idea it's good points, now I have to go stand in line to exchange it!! Not happy

name: Ree
review: Needed to replace my Conair mirror I bought at Ulta 1 year ago-the highest setting blew out.  The associate said it was not returnable (I had the receipt & I understand it's been 1 year).  The Revlon seemed the same so I bought it.  The highest setting on the new one was not as bright as the 1 setting left on the Conair.

name: Mirror purchaser
review: Product looks nice. Problems with highest intensity light not very bright. Also, the control to change light intensity in located in the base. It just takes a slight touch to change the brightness. It is extremely easy to accidentally touch the base and change the brightness or turn it off. Gets very frustrating.

name: LaLa
review: good value. clear view, not too pricey, stable, tilt holds position well

name: Unhappy in Indiana
review: I bought this mirror with great hopes that it would solve two issues for me with one being the 7x magnifier and the lighting feature.  Very disappointed in both.  Mirror is small and seems somewhat distorted possibly because us the shape and the light is definitely not bright enough to use to apply make-up.  I unfortunately did not keep the box as I was assure this was a answer to my prayers or I would definitely be returning it to Ulta.

name: brains-plus-beauty
review: This is a really good mirror for when you want to see up close in particularly for doing your makeup.  Plus I got this on sale! :)

name: TheBanker
review: The mirror is pretty, but the light was not bright and was a strange yellow tint.

name: Sandy
review: I returned this item because it was not bright enough especially when I pluck my eyebrows.

name: Mimi
review: Love this mirror. The light has 3 settings so you can easily adjust

name: Norma
review: It's great for just a mirror. I needed something bright and this was not what I was expecting. The light is not bright enough. The thing I did like was that it swivels all around.

name: Evie
review: Mirror needs to be bigger and brighter

name: nichole
review: I wish the light was brighter.

name: charles
review: Lighting on mirror is not bright at all not even the highest level exchanged for different mirror

name: Cindy
review: I bought this product and the stem of the mirror was not straight. I returned it for another and the second one was also askew. I decided to try it anyway. On the magnified side, my face was all distorted. Then after it was on for about 10 minutes, it shut off and would not go back on. I tried again several hours later with no luck. I returned it and will not purchase another!

name: cardinaldogs
review: I bought this mirror without seeing the light function. It is extremely dim as  I can barely see,the light. Just not going to work of me as my bathroom is dim on it's own so can't really do any close up work. I'll put it in the  spare bath for decor.

name: SusyQ
review: Perfect lighted mirror,  You can see everything you are doing applying your makeup.  Nice touch on light.

name: kil4hockey
review: I opened the box and the mirror has a huge scratch on it. Even if there wasn't a scratch I would not keep it because the lighting is too low. I want to be able to see what I am doing.

name: sharonhg
review: you touch the base to turn the light on/off or change intensity.  well, when you're handling your makeup items around the base, it's easy to accidentally turn it off, which happened several times every morning while putting on my makeup.  Really annoying.

name: Miss Contrare
review: This mirror is nice and the magnification mirror on the other side is useful. However, the "3 Light Settings" totally suck. Even with the brightest setting, you can barely see your face! Even though you can change the light bulbs, only 25W is allowed. Overall, I'm not happy with this purchase, but it's too late to return it.

name: Queen B
review: Got it as a Christmas gift for my mom and she loves it. It was hard to pick just one because Ulta had so many options but I'm glad i picked this one. Love that you just touch it to make the light brighter and dimmer.

name: Tracey the Makeup newbie
review: The best thing about this particular mirror is that I can adjust it however I need no matter what. Regardless of whether I am standing, sitting, or what chair I use.

name: Kat
review: I was really disappointed with this product because the lights were not how they were advertised. On the box the lights are presented as really bright, white led lights but the mirror actually has yellow lights that even at its brightest setting is not bright at all. Couldn't be used to do makeup in a room that is not well lit. Looks great but useless!

name: Kymbo3500
review: This mirror was so beautiful, but I had to return it. The lighting on each of the settings is poor. I wanted to use it to apply makeup for daytime, office evening as advertised, but the lighting on the mirror is horrible.

name: amarie
review: The bulb just isn't bright enough.

name: Kelli
review: Barely no light at all

name: Mema
review: This mirror was smaller than what I am used to.  Wasn't very bright and touch light was way too sensitive.  If you accidentally touch the base, the light goes off.

name: NL
review: Came in a busted in box and mirror was broken.  Returned for refund.

name: EBnurse
review: I bought one in store that ended up breaking after a week of use (something on the inside fried). I returned it and ordered another one online. I love it! The touch base can be a little sensitive at times but the three different settings are great! It is the perfect size to see your face in for applying foundation, and the magnified side is perfect for getting eye makeup just right. Overall, it's a great mirror!

name: Merry
review: Do not have anything positive to say about this mirror.

name: Judge C
review: Mirror face too small and light not bright enough. Also, the touch switch is very sensitive.

name: Smart Shopper
review: This product works great for applying makeup and arching eyebrows

name: CK
review: Retuning it says it all

name: lovelylin110
review: The mirror's idea of touch on/off is good however the sensitivity is way too acessible when you try to move it at all. It would have been better placed higher up on the mirror- I returned it and got one with a regular on/off switch.

name: Allison
review: This mirror had a good magnification, but the light was terrible. I bought the mirror as a gift for my mother and she has to return it to find something with a brighter light.

name: Jacky
review: Good size!!

name: DW
review: I would not purchase this mirror again.  If you just move your head the light will turn off.  Also the power of the light is not that bright.   Spend a little more and get something else.

name: KLacy
review: Light blew and no bulbs work with it.

name: Judy
review: I love that this mirror has three settings and the magnification is perfect.

name: Teena S
review: I absolutely love this mirror! I highly recommend it!

name: Adimakeuplover
review: I expected it to be brighter.

name: Danie
review: This mirror serves its purpose, but I have to sit REALLY close to it for it to actually light up my face. Also, I wish the light was more natural instead of yellowish.

name: Christina
review: I was really excited to purchase this mirror but I was highly disappointed. The light hurts my eyes because it is not bright at all and its like you have to squint a bit. The mirror distorts my face shape somewhat and I look very round. I just do not like it and am returning it.

name: Martha
review: The light is too soft

name: Cstate
review: I had to return the makeup mirror the day after I purchased it because it's light was too dim for me to see clearly enough to put my make up on well.  Otherwise, the stand and it's height were ideal and the magnifier side was perfect.  I was quite disappointed about the fact that I had to return it.

name: Sierra
review: It's good for a temporary mirror or one you buy until you can afford a nice one. Does it's job but isn't anything special. Light isn't bright enough

name: Katie
review: I use this every time I apply makeup before going out. I love it!

name: Starting with makeup
review: Great for make up! I wish the light would get brighter!

name: Bonnie the Buckeye
review: I love this mirror and it has great lighting and magnification!

name: Zygomatica
review: I liked the oval shape and having two mirrors (normal and magnification). But the light with this mirror is awful. Even at brightest setting I do not consider it helpful for make up application. When you use this you must already be in a well lit room.

name: MissKimberlyJo
review: good for up close makeup application, and great for seeing details, especially when plucking hairs.

name: hannah22222
review: I bought this for my vanity because my room is very poorly lit so I figured it would help. & sadly it did not. The light is very dim even on high power which was a let down! I have this one star because though the lighting was mediocre the mirror did its job of amplifying my facial features & made it easy to see smaller areas. Unfortunately I just returned it the next day

name: Kris
review: This mirror is exactly what I was looking for! It has a very clear and clean mirror with great magnification on the opposite side. The mirror has beautiful soft lighting that goes well with the lighting I already have around my vanity.

name: Rinner
review: I use this product to do my hair & make-up in the morning. The things that are great about this mirror is that its clear and bright. The things not so great about it are that it fogs semi easily and it gets finger prints on it fairly easily.

name: Ferrrocious
review: Use in an amready well-lit room! I bought it bc the lighting in my room stinks, but it's not bright enough to help.

name: ady
review: The "light" is extremely dim. Definitely not worth the money.

name: LevanaHyll
review: This mirror is big, and it's very pretty. The outer structure is made of chrome in a satin finish and has three setting for light intensity, low, medium, and high. It goes on with a touch to the base. The mirror is sturdy and well made. My only problem with this mirror is the intensity of the lighting, or rather, lack of. I wanted a mirror with similar lighting intensity to a Clairol trifold mirror I had as a teen, which lit with fluorescent tubes. I like to use intense lighting when applying my makeup because if it looks good in intense light it'll look good in any lighting. So, yeah, I was disappointed by this feature I would term as a flaw because the mirror looks really stylish and beautiful and I was looking forward to including it in my dressing table set up. I did return it to Ulta with my receipt and was immediately refunded my money's without any problem. Big plus for Ulta there. I made sure the mirror was repackaged as it was when I purchased it as well. Some people don't want super bright lighting but I actually require it from any lighted mirror I have. Currently I purchased the Jerdon trifold mirror which has the lighting intensity I was looking for.

name: Codygirl
review:
The mirror sits at a good height, swivels the right
way and I love the touch base to turn it on and off.

name: Cindy Ann
review: The lighting in the mirror was lower than my room lighting and casts a lot of shadows. The lights in a circle caused odd reflections in my eyes.

name: Emily
review: I absolutely love it!!!!! It's the perfect size.... Not too big not too small just right, and the lighting is perfect easy to see when your doing your makeup. I give it 5 stars easily:)

name: yvettemakeuplover
review: returning it asap, the light is too dim on all levels and the frame on mine was not glued properly that its coming off.

name: Kimmie
review: The lighting didn't even work...do NOT buy!

name: Maureen
review: I would not purchase this mirror again. It had 3 brightness options but even the brightest do not get bright enough. I am now trying to find a better mirror that fits into my budget.

name: KayKay
review: I use it when I travel.

name: DivaD
review: 3 settings...dim, dimmer, dimmest. So disappointed. Hard to find a reasonably priced vanity mirror. It's going back.

name: Deedee
review: I use this mirror daily!

name: Jane
review: Very nice, clean lines. Very convenient on the vanity. My one complaint, and it's a big one, it isn't bright enough. When doing makeup I like very bright, even lighting.

name: Britney
review: I use this to do my makeup and hair.

name: Lynnie
review: I did not want to spend a fortune on a make up mirror. I received a really good one previously as a gift and when it was time to replace it, I was surprised at the cost. So I settled. This one would be okay if it had different light settings instead of low, medium and high. The touch settings on the base are too easy to accidentally hit and it's annoying.

name: Priscilla
review: Regular mirror light is very dim.

name: rg
review: Purchased for my 75 yr old mother and she loves it.

name: Webbie
review: The mirror itself was fine but the light is too dim.  My bathroom lighting is not the best and the light on the mirror did not improve the situation.

name: Cc
review: Love this mirror

name: Jenn
review: The light was too dim and yellow on the highest setting. Returning

name: randeemtn
review: Even at the brightest setting it's a dim yellow tinged light that barely illuminates the face and barely shows up in the mirror. Will be returning.

name: Wanda
review: It was to short. I stand up to put makeup on. Will return and try something else.

name: Linda
review: I couldn't use it no way to plug in at the store to review before purchase

name: Renie
review: Bought as a gift.

name: Shawn's Queen B
review: This is a great mirror. I love the magnified side. Great for putting on makeup without my glasses.
